result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Myron McCurry

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Myron McCurry appeared by video.  Attorney Michael F. Hart in court for Myron McCurry.  Attorney Amy E Spanczak in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for Scheduling conference.  Defense needs additional discovery from the State and requests additional time for possible resolution.  Defendant approved to appear via zoom for next hearing date. Case adjourned to Br. 9.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Myron McCurry appeared by video.  Attorney Morgan Minter appeared by video on behalf of  Attorney Michael Hart for Myron McCurry.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Court took judicial notice of case #11CF4358. Sworn for the State: MPD SGT J. Joliff. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 09.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Myron McCurry in court with Attorney Michael F. Hart; both appear by video.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is not present due to vacation. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Myron McCurry in court with attorney Morgan Lynn Minter.  Stephanie Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 061637,
Payable Number: 1017748,
Receipt Number: 22RP027165,
Amount: $20.00
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 7/18/22 @ 1p
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 07/18/2022@1pm
